titles.title: Plant Patent Amendments Act of 1997
Plant Patent Amendments Act of 1998
Plant Patent Amendments Act of 1998
Plant Patent Amendment Act of 1998
To amend title 35, United States Code, to protect patent owners against the unauthorized sale of plant parts taken from plants illegally reproduced, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Courts and Intellectual Property.
Mr. Coble moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Amendment SP 3830 proposed by Senator Craig for Senator Leahy.
Amendment SP 3830 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Mr. Coble moved that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 10/15/1998--Passed Senate amended. Plant Patent Amendments Act of 1998 - Amends Federal patent law with respect to the right in the grant of a plant patent to exclude others from asexually reproducing such plant. Adds the right to exclude others from using, offering for sale, selling, or importing asexually reproduced plants and plant parts. Directs the United States Patent and Trademark Office to develop and implement computer networks with remote library sites in requesting rural States such that citizens will have enhanced access to information in their State's patent and trademark depository library.
